Articles.Content:
Dynamic Warp 0.22+

This is my first mod:)

Description:

This mod lets you slow down and speed up time.

Be careful when using over 4x Dynamic warp! This can result in a very, very low framerate!

Usage:

LeftAlt + Numpad+ : Increase Time speed

LeftAlt + Numpad- : Decrease Time speed

LeftAlt + Backspace : Reset Time speed

Lisence:

WTFPL License

Releases:

Mediafire

As i couldn't find any updates for this mod I decided to update it on my own.

This now hasn't restrictions on 1/64x and 100x so you can LITERALLY stop time and run it backwards.

Basically you can increase/decrease the timesteps for the physics-calculation with this, which is useful when for ex. you have a very part heavy craft that makes the game lag.

Updates:

Jan-5: Now only one warp rate change per keypress

A big thanks to Deadbeef for the original mod and arsenic87 for the initial .23 update

Edited March 14, 2014 by StratoK
Update
... Is this not exactly the same as the games timewarp function?
Could you perhaps explain what this does differently from the stock time warp?
Yes, what's different?
Well, after reading his post, I think it allows us to use more than four times physwarp.
Based on the description, I'd say it allows faster physics-warp
It has higher time warp capabilities, AND IT CAN SLOW DOWN TIME!
Ah sweet! I was wondering when someone would add a slow motion feature. Hopefully it'll improve my frame rate when launching a 500 part ship!!! Gonna have to give this little mod a go.

Well, this guy either a) updated it or recoded it, so that it works in the current version. And then you pfft at him? That's very rude, you know.

Dynamic Warp was an old mod back for the .17-.20 versions (roughly).

It appears he updated it.

Same name, same function.

Please give credit to the original author, thank you.

P.S. I appreciate the update to the mod.

Edit: Same controls to.

1. it's very nice to see that DEADBEEF's old mods stand the test of time, we need to see more of that guy! he just popped in for like a couple weeks and released 2 gamechanging plugins that even startled the devs (editor tools, this)

2. what is different in this version? somebody made a version for .21 and it still works fine. Actually, my old 20.2 version still works!
Post edited to prevent confusion...
This mod is definitely new. The old one doesn't work anymore IIRC (and even if it does, it can't be updated), since the author disappeared.

Sorry for le pttf earlier. Misunderstood it.

Thought he just reposted the addon without editting it and givin credit

Edited November 8, 2013 by rasheed
Love this mod, unfortunately backspace is the default key for setting your focus back to orbital view, and tied to the action group Abort.

Love this mod, unfortunately backspace is the default key for setting your focus back to orbital view, and tied to the action group Abort.

All of which can be reset to other keys.

I'm glad to see this mod back. Thank you for updateing it. I remember in the old mod you had to attach a certain part to your ship to make the mod work and I was curious if that was still a requirement.

I'm glad to see this mod back. Thank you for updateing it. I remember in the old mod you had to attach a certain part to your ship to make the mod work and I was curious if that was still a requirement.

If I remember correctly, back in the .18 days a mod could only be loaded when it was attached to a part as a part module. This isn't reguired anymore.
I can't seem to get this to work =( I have it installed properly, but when I alt - nothing happens.

I can't seem to get this to work =( I have it installed properly, but when I alt - nothing happens.

You need to press 'left alt' and at the same time the modifier key you want ( 'numpad +' or'numpad -')
Ah, the previous version I had was left alt and the - button next to '0'
very interesting!

Deadbeef was the bees effing knees man.

Within just a few weeks last year he had released Subassemblies, Editor Tools, and Dynamic Warp, all of which were absolute essentials.

Thanks for the update StratoK.
